DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigates serum and stool biomarkers as predictors for post-operative feeding intolerance in infant patients with complex congenital heart defects who undergo single ventricle staged palliation surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Biomarkers for Feeding Intolerance in Infants With Complex Congenital Heart Defects Undergoing Single Ventricle Staged Palliation
DOC.criteria: Full term gestational period (37 weeks gestation or greater) minimum of 2.5kg or greater body weight diagnosis of single ventricle physiology, or complex congenital cyanotic heart disease requiring staged palliation surgery in the form of Norwoodtype procedure, systemictopulmonary artery shunt, or pulmonary artery banding. Have diseases affecting other organs, have major congenital anomalies such as Hirschsprung disease, imperforate anus, CHARGE syndrome, or VACTERL association.
